formattedAddress: 98 Mott St, New York, NY 10013, USA
adrFormatAddress: 98 Mott St, New York, NY 10013, USA

originalText.text: We went to the Mott Street Eatery for dinner and had the dessert from this kiosk. They sell dishes made from soy bean. We ordered the Soy Bean Dessert. It goes with cold or hot option. We paired it with the Grass Jelly. The lady was very nice and gave us a lot of advice on what to choose. The dessert was very authentic and similar to what I had in Vietnam. Love it and will be back to Mott Street Eatery for this dessert

originalText.text: Nice food and good service. Located in a food court.

text.text: Nice food and good service. Located in a food court.

originalText.text: Overall the food sucks. My friend and I got scammed by the photos. We ordered $6 three fried stuffed treasure and it only came with two silken tofu, 2 stuffed peppers and 2 thinly sliced eggplants. So is $1 per piece. Overpriced and taste bland. They used the silken tofu instead the fried tofu. When we received the order, the order was so light. Once we opened it, there is only 6 thin stuffed pieces. Please beware of this restaurant. Is a scam.

originalText.text: LOVE this is the best beancurd i've had in america. So good. The owner is very nice, and he can tailor the amount of sugar syrup u want to your taste. Both hot and cold beancurd available. So good.

text.text: LOVE this is the best beancurd i've had in america. So good. The owner is very nice, and he can tailor the amount of sugar syrup u want to your taste. Both hot and cold beancurd available. So good.

originalText.text: This is an excellent food stall located at the back right of the food court.  After doing a tour of the rest of the stalls, I got a strong vibe of authenticity and care from this place and it urned out to be a great instinct.  The woman who runs the front counter is very friendly and passionate about her food but not pushy, and very willing to explain things.  They serve soft tofu from a giant rice cooker that she says is her mother’s recipe, which I had and was excellent.  I also had the three stuffed items (tofu, peppers, and eggplant) and they were also great — fried to order, not greasy, delicious sauce.  Soy sauce egg was good but not great — could have been cracked a bit more before marinating.  The cook came out of the back room and encouraged me to try the sweet potato tofu pocket — a deep fried half moon that was stuffed with sweet bean and some other ingredients I will have to assess on a future visit.  It was the best thing I ate there.  I highly recommend the place — there are other great options in the food court but I would suggest giving this place a try on you next visit, even for just the tofu and the sweet potato/tofu pockets.
